item.title: FT Most Read: Thursday, October 31, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. UK borrowing costs hit highest level this year as gilt sell-off intensifies
2. Business and wealthy bear brunt of £40bn tax increases in UK Budget
3. Starbucks turns to Sharpies and price freeze to stem traffic slide
4. Closure of UK inheritance tax ‘loophole’ to penalise estates of wealthy pensioners
5. [Opinion] Reeves has made her choice — but success is not guaranteed
item.guid: FT Most Read: Thursday, October 31, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
